title: Cannot install tensorflow-gpu; pip killed
body_html:
Please make sure that this is a build/installation issue. As per our GitHub Policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests and build/installation issues on GitHub. tag:build_template

System information

  • OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Ubuntu 16.04 inside a Singularity image
  • TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): binary
  • TensorFlow version: 1.12.0
  • Python version: 3.6.6
  • Installed using virtualenv? pip? conda?: pip
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0 + 9.1 + 9.2 / 7.3.1.20
  • GPU model and memory: GeForce GT 740 / 1999 MiB

Describe the problem
When I go to install tensorflow-gpu, pip reports a message Killed. No errors or other messages. tensorflow installs just fine.

Provide the exact sequence of commands / steps that you executed before running into the problem

pip install --user tensorflow-gpu

Any other info / logs

Collecting tensorflow-gpu
  Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/55/7e/bec4d62e9dc95e828922c6cec38acd9461af8abe749f7c9def25ec4b2fdb/tensorflow_gpu-1.12.0-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (281.7MB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 281.7MB 9.4kB/s
Killed

body: Please make sure that this is a build/installation issue. As per our [GitHub Policy](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/ISSUES.md), we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests and build/installation issues on GitHub. tag:build_template **System information** - OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Ubuntu 16.04 inside a Singularity image - TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): binary - TensorFlow version: 1.12.0 - Python version: 3.6.6 - Installed using virtualenv? pip? conda?: pip - CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0 + 9.1 + 9.2 / 7.3.1.20 - GPU model and memory: GeForce GT 740 / 1999 MiB **Describe the problem** When I go to install `tensorflow-gpu`, pip reports a message `Killed`. No errors or other messages. `tensorflow` installs just fine. **Provide the exact sequence of commands / steps that you executed before running into the problem** ``` pip install --user tensorflow-gpu ``` **Any other info / logs** ``` Collecting tensorflow-gpu Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/55/7e/bec4d62e9dc95e828922c6cec38acd9461af8abe749f7c9def25ec4b2fdb/tensorflow_gpu-1.12.0-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (281.7MB) 100% |████████████████████████████████| 281.7MB 9.4kB/s Killed ```
